title: Over 2,400 live turtles seized at Trichy International Airport, investigations underway - The Times of India
summary:
Over 2,400 live turtles seized at Trichy International Airport, investigations underway

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

Authorities have conducted a significant bust at Trichy International Airport, seizing over 2,400 live turtles from a shipment. Investigations are currently underway to understand the origins and intended destination of the reptiles.

  • Over 2,400 live turtles were discovered by authorities.
  • The turtles were found during routine checks at Trichy International Airport.
  • Investigations are focused on identifying the individuals involved in this illegal trade.
  • This incident highlights ongoing wildlife trafficking issues in the region.
Authorities reaffirm their commitment to combat wildlife trafficking and protect endangered species.

This seizure demonstrates the ongoing efforts by law enforcement to curb wildlife trafficking and protect vulnerable species from illegal trade.
newTitle: Over 2,400 Live Turtles Seized at Trichy Airport

'Why can't people own the dollars' Deepak Shenoy debates RBI restriction on mutual funds investing in foreign stocks | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Why can’t people own the dollars? Deepak Shenoy debates RBI restriction on mutual funds investing in foreign stocks

Date: December 29, 2024

Source: Live Mint

Deepak Shenoy advocates for an increase in the limit for mutual funds investing in foreign stocks, proposing a raise from the current $8 billion to $50 billion, arguing the existing limit has been unchanged since 2009.

  • Shenoy highlights the disparity between mutual fund limits and individual investment allowances.
  • He questions why Indian mutual funds can't invest more in foreign stocks when individual investors can invest significantly more through foreign brokers.
  • Calls for a reevaluation of the RBI's stance on ownership of foreign assets, suggesting that individuals should have more access to invest through mutual funds.
“Why do we still have restrictions on Indian mutual funds investing in foreign stocks, when we can do the same thing as individuals?” – Deepak Shenoy
newTitle: Deepak Shenoy Challenges RBI on Mutual Fund Restrictions for Foreign Stocks

The discourse surrounding Indian immigrants in the U.S. technology sector has intensified due to a viral post accusing an Indian CEO of mismanagement and biased hiring practices.

  • The post claims the CEO ousted original founders and replaced them with Indian executives.
  • Allegations include using the COVID-19 pandemic to implement pay cuts and halt promotions.

  • Outsourcing of work to India disrupted company culture and client satisfaction.

title: Housing supply up 44 pc in NCR this year to 53K units; luxury home share in launches 60 pc: Anarock | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Housing supply up 44 pc in NCR this year to 53K units; luxury home share in launches 60 pc: Anarock

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Anarock

This year, the Delhi-NCR housing market experienced a remarkable 44% growth in new housing supply, amounting to 53,000 units, with a substantial share being ultra-luxury homes.

  • The number of new residential property launches totaled 36,735 units in 2023.
  • Ultra-luxury homes, priced above ₹2.5 crore, constituted nearly 60% of the new supply.
  • Sales in the Delhi-NCR market declined by 6% to 61,900 units compared to the previous year.
  • Overall housing launches in seven major Indian cities saw a 7% decrease.
  • The total sales across these seven cities also saw a marginal decline of 4% this year.
  • Anarock's Chairman noted that elections and slowed project approvals affected new housing supply.
Anarock Chairman Anuj Puri stated, "2024 has been a mixed bag for the Indian housing sector... sales also saw a marginal decline... offset by a 16 percent jump in the overall sales value."

In conclusion, despite the challenges posed by the economic environment, the luxury segment remains resilient, indicating a shift in consumer preferences in the housing market.
newTitle: Housing Supply Sees 44% Increase in NCR This Year, Luxury Homes Dominate

title: Hero XPulse 421 design trademarked ahead of global unveil. Check details - HT Auto
summary:
Hero XPulse 421 Design Trademarked Ahead of Global Unveil

Publication Date: 29 Dec 2024, Source: Hindustan Times

Hero MotoCorp is set to launch the new XPulse 421 next year, with a design patent recently filed, hinting at a potential reveal at the Bharat Mobility Expo 2025. The motorcycle promises innovation with a larger displacement engine, unique design changes, and competitive performance compared to rivals.

  • The XPulse 421 features a new 421 cc liquid-cooled single-cylinder engine.
  • Expected power output is around 40 bhp and torque of 45 Nm.
  • It will come equipped with a 6-speed gearbox with a slipper clutch.
  • Design changes include a flat headlamp and a redesigned fuel tank.
  • The bike will be built on a new trellis frame with long travel suspension.
First teased at EICMA, the XPulse 421 is positioned as a competitive adventure touring motorcycle.

The XPulse 421 is anticipated to make a significant impact in the adventure touring segment, combining modern design with robust performance specifications.
newTitle: Hero XPulse 421 Design Trademarked Ahead of Global Unveil

title: ITC Demerger Record Date: Will buying stock on Jan 6, 2025 make you eligible for ITC Hotels shares? - ET Now
summary:
ITC Demerger Record Date: Will buying stock on Jan 6, 2025 make you eligible for ITC Hotels shares?

Updated: December 29, 2024 13:15 IST Source: ET Now News

ITC's proposed hotels business demerger will become effective from January 2025, with January 6, 2025 set as the record date for eligibility of shareholders.

  • ITC's proposed hotels business demerger will come into effect from January 2025.
  • The record date for determining eligibility is January 6, 2025.
  • Shareholders will receive equity shares of ITC Hotels based on this record date.
Eligible shareholders will receive one share of ITC Hotels for every 10 shares they hold in ITC.

The ITC Hotels demerger is significant as it represents a strategic split in the company's business, aimed at enhancing shareholder value.

title: Charles Dolan dies at 98: Billionaire founder of HBO, Cablevision leaves exceptional legacy in media and entertainment - Hindustan Times
summary:
Charles Dolan dies at 98: Billionaire founder of HBO, Cablevision leaves exceptional legacy in media and entertainment

Date: Dec 29, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Charles Dolan, the billionaire founder of HBO and Cablevision, passed away at the age of 98, leaving behind an unmatched legacy in media and entertainment.

  • Dolan founded HBO in 1972, which transformed television with premium content.
  • He was also the founder of Cablevision and News12, the first 24-hour cable news channel.
  • In a 2018 interview, Dolan discussed the early days of HBO and its origin as a hotel movie service.
  • His family holds a net worth of approximately $5.4 billion.
  • Dolan is survived by six children, 19 grandchildren, and five great-grandchildren.
“It is with deep sorrow that we announce the passing of our beloved father and patriarch, Charles Dolan, the visionary founder of HBO and Cablevision,”

Dolan's innovative contributions to television have significantly shaped the media landscape, impacting countless viewers and the entertainment industry.
newTitle: Charles Dolan, HBO and Cablevision Founder, Passes Away at 98

title: 3 Japanese Brands To Come Together To Rival Toyota? - MotorOctane

3 Japanese Brands To Come Together To Rival Toyota?

Nissan is facing financial struggles and is reportedly considering a merger with Honda to compete with Toyota. The companies have been discussing a partnership for technology and EV development.

  • Nissan has struggled with mismanagement and a failing product lineup.
  • A merger between Honda and Nissan, potentially including Mitsubishi, is anticipated.
  • The new entity aims to focus on cost reduction and new energy vehicles.
  • This merger could create the third-largest automaker globally with a projected value of over USD 50 billion.
  • The merger is expected to be finalized by June 2025 and a holding company set up by August 2026.

Internet’s Reaction

The merger announcement elicited mixed reactions online, with some seeing it as a necessary move against the dominance of Chinese EVs, while others expressed concerns about Nissan's troubled history affecting Honda.

Should Toyota Worry?

While Toyota currently seems unaffected by this development, the challenge of restoring Nissan remains significant for Honda.

title: Air Canada aircraft catches fire after scary landing hours after fatal South Korea plane tragedy - Hindustan Times
summary:
Air Canada Aircraft Catches Fire After Scary Landing

Date: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: HT News Desk

An Air Canada flight experienced a harrowing incident at Halifax airport, skidding down the runway and catching fire due to a broken landing gear. This event occurred just hours after a deadly crash in South Korea.

  • An Air Canada flight made an emergency landing at Halifax airport.
  • The aircraft skidded and caught fire after suffering landing gear failure.
  • No casualties were reported in the Halifax incident.
  • The incident followed a tragic plane crash in South Korea, where a Jeju Air Boeing 737 exploded on landing, resulting in 179 presumed deaths.
  • Footage purportedly showed the aircraft's wings scraping the runway, leading to the fiery mishap.

This accident raises serious concerns about air safety, especially coming on the heels of another devastating plane mishap.

summary:

Donald Trump's potential return to the White House is expected to intensify global trade tensions, fueling geopolitical crises and likely pushing gold prices higher.

  • Gold has delivered a robust return of around 21% year-to-date.
  • Analysts predict that heightened geopolitical tensions will disrupt the stock market during Trump's potential second term.
  • The U.S. dollar's strength may moderate gold price increases.

title: Year Ender 2024: Big ticket investments boosts Tamil Nadu's USD 1 trillion dream - CNBCTV18
summary:
Tamil Nadu's 2024 Progress Towards a $1 Trillion Economy

Publication Date: 2024

Source: [Insert Source Here]

Tamil Nadu made significant strides in 2024 to achieve its ambitious goal of a USD 1 trillion economy by 2030, driven by major investments and strategic policies initiated by the DMK government.

  • The state hosted its first Global Investors Meet (GIM) in January 2024, securing ₹6.64 lakh crore in investment commitments that could create 26 lakh jobs.
  • Significant investments include ₹16,000 crore from VinFast for a manufacturing facility, generating 20,000 jobs, and ₹9,000 crore from Tata Motors for electric vehicle production.
  • Chief Minister MK Stalin engaged with international investors, signing multiple MoUs in the US and Spain totaling ₹7,618 crore in commitments, leading to the creation of 12,000 jobs.
  • The government focused on boosting the electric vehicle sector by exploring charging infrastructure along major roads.
  • Mini-TIDEL Parks will be established to extend IT sector benefits to smaller towns, each accommodating around 500 IT professionals.
  • Political analyst Sumanth Raman highlighted the need for greater transparency regarding investment commitments with a public dashboard.
“It is the easiest thing to do (to set up a dashboard). But the government has not done it.” - Sumanth Raman

2024 was a key year for Tamil Nadu as it positioned itself for future economic growth amid ongoing efforts to strengthen investor relations and local job creation.
newTitle: Tamil Nadu's 2024 Progress Towards a $1 Trillion Economy
